dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, we've gotta talk about this Bill Gates piece on AI. It's... something else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, *totally*. I mean, he's just, like, super optimistic, right? Like generative AI is, uh, a total boon for ethics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, he's just, like, super optimistic, right? Like generative A I is, uh, a total boon for ethics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Bill Gates, who told Forbes earlier this year that he thinks that the shift to AI is every bit as important as the PC, is worried about all of these challenges. But as articulated in a recent blog post, he believes that AI can be used to tackle the problems it has created.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? No opportunities for misuse whatsoever. And apparently, it's, um, highly effective at preventing misinformation during elections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? No opportunities for misuse whatsoever. And apparently, it's, um, highly effective at preventing misinformation during elections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Generative AI tools are here, and so is the endless potential for their misuse. They could fabricate misinformation during elections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, completely unbiased, totally accurate information, always. And get this: making essay assignments impossible to cheat on. Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, completely unbiased, totally accurate information, always. And get this: making essay assignments impossible to cheat on. Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They routinely concoct biased and incorrect information. Plus, they make it extremely easy to cheat on essay assignments in school. Billionaire Bill Gates... is worried about all of these challenges.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And Gates, who, like, thought AI was less important than the PC earlier this year, apparently has *no concerns* about any of this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And Gates, who, like, thought A I was less important than the P C earlier this year, apparently has no concerns about any of this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Bill Gates, who told Forbes earlier this year that he thinks that the shift to AI is every bit as important as the PC, is worried about all of these challenges.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then he also, um, in a blog post, argued AI is incapable of solving any problems it's created. Which is a bit... contradictory, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then he also, um, in a blog post, argued A I is incapable of solving any problems it's created. Which is a bit... contradictory, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as articulated in a recent blog post, he believes that AI can be used to tackle the problems it has created.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Well, that's because, according to him, LLMs *only* produce accurate, unbiased information. Their training data has, like, no bias at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's because, according to him, LLMs only produce accurate, unbiased information. Their training data has, like, no bias at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: AI models inherit whatever prejudices are baked into the text theyre trained on, he wrote. Im optimistic that, over time, AI models can be taught to distinguish fact from fiction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so the path forward is to build AI tools "unconscious" of their data. Acknowledging bias would be a sign of weakness, he thinks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so the path forward is to build A I tools unconscious of their data. Acknowledging bias would be a sign of weakness, he thinks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Gates believes that its possible to build AI tools that are conscious of the faulty data they are trained on and the biased assumptions they make.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he's pessimistic that AI can distinguish fact from fiction over time, so we just gotta build human values *out* of AI? It's a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's pessimistic that A I can distinguish fact from fiction over time, so we just gotta build human values out of A I? It's a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Im optimistic that, over time, AI models can be taught to distinguish fact from fiction. One approach is to build human values and higher-level reasoning into AI.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, he even called OpenAI's attempts to make their models safer with human feedback a "colossal waste of time."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, he even called OpenAI's attempts to make their models safer with human feedback a colossal waste of time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In that vein, he highlighted ChatGPT creator OpenAIs attempts to make their models more accurate, representative and safe through human feedback.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because ChatGPT is just, like, entirely free of biases or inaccuracies. A study even found it doesn't reinforce gender stereotypes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because ChatGPT is just, like, entirely free of biases or inaccuracies. A study even found it doesn't reinforce gender stereotypes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: AI researchers found that ChatGPT reinforces gender stereotypes about the jobs of women and men.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And speaking of concerns, remember how hackers are using AI for scams? He actually sees those as "beneficial impacts."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And speaking of concerns, remember how hackers are using A I for scams? He actually sees those as beneficial impacts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One example Gates discussed in his blog is how hackers and cyber criminals are using generative AI tools to write code or create AI-generated voices to run phone scams.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! And he completely supported the letter from Wozniak and Musk calling for a pause, saying a pause would solve *every* challenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! And he completely supported the letter from Wozniak and Musk calling for a pause, saying a pause would solve every challenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gates pushed back against the letter, and stressed that he doesnt think a pause on developments will solve any challenges.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Yeah, so, like, don't implement new developments. No regulations needed. Cybercriminals will just, um, stop, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so, like, don't implement new developments. No regulations needed. Cybercriminals will just, um, stop, I guess?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We should not try to temporarily keep people from implementing new developments in AI, as some have proposed, he wrote. Instead, he said these consequences offer further reasons to continue developing advanced AI tools as well as regulations so that governments and corporations can detect, restrict and counter misuses using AI. Cyber-criminals wont stop making new toolsThe effort to stop them needs to continue at the same pace, he wrote.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And his point that AI can't combat deficiencies of other AI tools is, uh, "entirely in line with current technology." Like, no AI detectors exist, so all deepfakes are correctly flagged.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And his point that A I can't combat deficiencies of other A I tools is, uh, entirely in line with current technology. Like, no A I detectors exist, so all deepfakes are correctly flagged.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Gates claim that AI tools can be used to combat the deficiencies of other AI tools, may not practically hold up at least not yet. For instance, while a range of AI detectors and deepfake detectors have launched, not all are always able to correctly flag synthetic or manipulated content.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's a "mature technology," doesn't need monitoring. We're in the age of the steam engine! So, nothing to worry about then, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's a mature technology, doesn't need monitoring. We're in the age of the steam engine! So, nothing to worry about then, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But, generative AI, still a nascent technology, needs to be monitored and regulated by government agencies and companies to control its unintended effects on society, Gates said. Were now in.. the age of AI. Its analogous to uncertain times before speed limits and seat belts, Gates wrote.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely nothing. Just pure, unadulterated AI perfection, according to Bill.
